page.title: 04VILLAGES NEAR PETERSFIELD 2
page.content: { {Steep}is a small village about a mile north of Petersfield. It gets its name from the dramatic landscape around it which has been known for about 100 years as 'Little Switzerland'. It is a popular local beauty spot. The village is a straggle of houses with one shop, a pub, garage and small primary school. The Church of All Saints stands at the top of the main road. Bedales school is an important part of the village. { {Stroud}is West of Petersfield and even smaller than Steep. The site of a Roman Villa was found there and excavated by people from Bedales before World War II but it has now been covered over. Stroud has a primary school but no church.
